intro: Leucas mathewiana, commonly known as the Mathew's leucas, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
